New Records: Victor Wembanyama recorded 25 points, nine rebounds, seven assists, five steals, and five blocks, achieving at least five in five categories for the second time in his career.
Chris Paul contributed with 19 points, 10 assists, and six rebounds for the Spurs.
Key Match Events: Patty Mills made three straight 3-pointers to power a 13-0 run, giving the Jazz a 30-19 lead going into the second quarter.
The Spurs erased a double-digit deficit twice and went ahead for good midway through the third with a 12-0 run.
After the Jazz cut the deficit to 73-67, Utah scored just two baskets over the next six minutes, allowing the Spurs to pull away with a 19-6 run.
Pre-Game Insights: The Jazz was without starting forward Lauri Markkanen, who was out with back spasms.
Patty Mills' three consecutive 3-pointers and the subsequent 13-0 run were pivotal early in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Spurs' performance was praised, with Wembanyama and Paul highlighted for their contributions.
The Jazz struggled without Markkanen, leading to challenges in generating consistent offense.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jazz had too many empty possessions at critical junctures, contributing to their struggles.
Keyonte George committed a career-high seven turnovers, leading to 35 points for the Spurs.
Others: The game was played at Vivint Arena in Salt Lake City.
